_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: Discord Tickets Bot
author: contact@bisecthosting.com
description: The official egg for the Discord Tickets bot.

installation.script:
output_file="/mnt/server/.env"
random=$(cat /dev/urandom | tr -dc 'a-f0-9' | fold -w 48 | head -n 1)
echo "# Most environment variables can be found on the Startup page" >> $output_file
echo "ENCRYPTION_KEY=${random}" >> $output_file
echo "HTTP_EXTERNAL=http://${SERVER_IP}:${SERVER_PORT}" >> $output_file
echo "HTTP_PORT=" >> $output_file
echo "Environment variables written to $output_file"

variables.name: Database Provider
variables.description: The type of database you want to use. SQLite is not recommended in production.

variables.name: Database URL
variables.description:
Leave blank if using SQLite, but SQLite is not recommended in production.
https://discordtickets.app/self-hosting/configuration/#db_connection_url

variables.name: Owner IDs
variables.description: Comma-separated list of the bot owners' Discord IDs. The default is that of the bot developer and is recommended to leave in if you want them to be able to debug issues for you.

variables.name: PTERODACTYL
variables.description: Internal variable to denote to the bot that it is in a pterodactyl container, required for functionality

variables.name: Trust proxies?
variables.description:
Should proxy headers be trusted?
Only enable this if running behind a safe reverse proxy.

variables.name: Override archive
variables.description: If set to "false", archives will be forcibly disabled in all servers.

variables.name: Auto-publish commands?
variables.description: If enabled, commands will be published on startup so you don't need to do it manually.
